abstract: A report painted a picture of recurring neglect and avoidance that culminated in a fatal explosion at a Texas refinery in 2005.
snippet: A report painted a picture of recurring neglect and avoidance that culminated in a fatal explosion at a Texas refinery in 2005.
lead_paragraph: LONDON, Jan. 16 — An investigation led by former Secretary of State James A. Baker III has concluded that weak leadership at BP and a lack of attention to effective safety helped create a dangerous setting that led to 15 deaths at the oil giant’s Texas refinery, according to the report released Tuesday.

headline.main: Inquiry Faults Management at BP in Blast That Killed 15
headline.print_headline: Inquiry Faults Management At BP in Blast That Killed 15
